analyzed: ati chatti yat theḥ a padāna

translated: the one who sees the truth, the highest, had attained Final Emancipation,
I made a chatta and a chatta-umbrella,
and placed them on the Shrine.
From time to time I went,🔽and worshipped the Leader of the World;
and placed it on the chatta.
I was a King of the Divinities;
I did not go to the human state,
this is the fruit of worshipping a Shrine.
and the eight liberations as well,
the Buddha’s instruction was accomplished.”🔽Thus it was that the Elder Atichatta recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā atichattiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Atichattiyattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai atichattiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽atichattiya therassa apadānam paṭhama
translated: The Elder Atichatta’s Story is finished.
